message: I would like to find out how you setup a staging site and how it's meant to be used. I've used Fabric to deploy to the production server but I'm curious on how to setup a staging sub domain or server. If anyone knows of a video that shows or explains it, that would be awesome! thanks!
If you use Chef, it is nice and easy :-) Just spin up a new machine with a different environment tag.
I use staging as a dry run area for production deploys. So whatever production does, staging does that too!

In environments where data changes frequently on the production servers (a CMS system or one with user generated content) while development is ongoing, staging servers are a good place that code going downstream can meet content coming upstream for QA in a non-critical/non-blocking environment.
@coderanger: does it make sense to use Chef for deployments with just one production server?

@eallik Sure, even with one server you still need to be able to remake it repeatably for alternate environments (like this question asks about) or for in the event of a failure. Also things almost never stay as just one server forever, and having full automation from the start means one less thing to worry about when looking to scale up.
+1 for the Chef recommendation... No matter how big or small your environment, Chef can help you sanely manage your environment(s).
